page.title: 09House building - fillings
page.content: {Wattle and Daub This was one of the first types of filling used in timber framed houses. A mixture of clay and straw was put in betwen a framework of branches and twigs. {Tile Hanging These are used for covering timber framed houses. A series of oak laths are nailed across the framework and then tiles are pegged into the laths. The tiles can be ordinary rectangular shapes or of a fancy design. {Weather-boarding This was very popular in the 18th and 19th centuries. It also covered a timber frame. Long narrow planks of oak or elm wood were pinned overlapping by nails to the oak framework of the house. They were often painted white in Kent. Nowadays plastic boarding is sometimes used.
